p: COVID-19 is a rapidly evolving pandemic. Asymptomatic individuals testing positive for SARS-CoV-2 and enforced to self-isolate at home were in Italy about 40% of all positive individuals at the beginning of the epidemic, then becoming >80% following the end of full lockdown ( GEDI visual, 2020). Fig. 1 reports the corresponding changes as percentage or odds; the latter detects the improvement of the index score better than the former because it is able to overcome the ceiling effects.
